gcci.text: Spot H100 pricing averaging $3.19/hr reflects easing supply constraints from late-2023/early-2024 allocations combined with the debut of H200/GB200, which is redirecting capex and pressuring legacy H100 utilization, while hyperscalers increasingly tie hardware sourcing to downstream workload performance to defend margins.

gtpi.text: At an average input price of $1.56/1M tokens, the market is pricing in aggressive API price wars and efficiency race dynamics—compression, speculative decoding, and competitive models (e.g., Qwen, Llama) are compressing unit economics, compelling providers to push rate-limits and caching as differentiators to maintain margins.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual AI load implies rising grid strain and curtailment risk for new deployments, driving utilities and hyperscalers toward firm, low-carbon supply (nuclear PPA negotiations, geothermal, long-duration storage) to avoid brownout/carbon penalties while keeping per-token and per-GPU costs stable.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment remains constructive but cautious: investors reward efficiency-led price deflation and revenue-per-ML engineer gains, while flagging capex overhang, token-margin compression, and grid reliability as the primary constraints on sustained growth.
